title: ELA Teacher
description:
**Job Overview**  
We are seeking a dedicated and passionate Teacher to join our educational team. The ideal candidate will have a strong commitment to fostering a positive learning environment and the ability to engage students. This role is particularly suited for individuals who are eager to contribute to the development of young minds in a public school setting.

**Duties**  
- Develop and implement engaging lesson plans that cater to diverse learning styles and abilities.  
- Educate students in core subjects, with a focus on English Language Arts and creative writing.  
- Utilize effective classroom management techniques to maintain a productive learning environment.  
- Conduct research to stay updated on educational best practices and incorporate innovative teaching strategies.  
- Mentor students, providing guidance and support to help them achieve their academic goals.  
- Manage student behavior through positive reinforcement and effective communication.  
- Collaborate with fellow educators to enhance curriculum development and share teaching resources.  
- Assess student progress regularly and provide constructive feedback to facilitate growth.

**Qualifications**  
- Bachelor's degree in Education or a related field; teaching certification preferred.  
- Experience in public school settings is highly desirable.  
- Strong skills in lesson planning, classroom management, and behavior management.  
- Excellent mentoring abilities with a passion for educating young learners.  
- Creative approach to teaching, particularly in areas such as creative writing and ELA.  
- Ability to conduct research for continuous improvement of teaching practices.

We invite enthusiastic educators who are committed to making a difference in the lives of their students to apply for this rewarding opportunity.

title: Medical Social Worker
description:
Premier HealthCare (PHC), a member of the YAI Network, is recognized by the US Surgeon General as a national model for the provision of health care, and by the National Council on Disabilities for raising the national standards of health care services for children and adults with developmental and intellectual disabilities. PHC has also earned national certification as a Level 3 Patient-Centered Medical Home by the National Committee on Quality Assurance (NCQA). PHC is unique in its quality of medical, dental, mental health, rehabilitation and specialty care provided to individuals with disabilities and their families.

**Key/Essential Functions & Responsibilities:**

· Cooperates with other professionals to evaluate patients' medical or physical condition and to assess patient needs

· Advocates for patients to resolve crises

· Collaborates with appropriate clinic staff to assess patient needs or develop plan treatments

· Investigates child abuse and/or neglect cases and takes authorized protective action, when necessary

· Intervenes in crisis situations to assist patients, families, caregivers

· Refers clients to community or social service programs

· Refers individuals to educational or work programs

· Coordinates with care managers and I/DD organizations

· Assists with PHC initiatives including PCMH

· Participates in bi-weekly clinical operations Meetings

· Participates monthly with the developmental and implementation of Quality improvement (QA/QI meetings)

· Completes variety of forms on behalf of patients

· May supervise MSW students and other interns/volunteers, with appropriate credentials

· Performs all other duties, as assigned

**Minimum Qualification Requirements** *including education, experience, licensure/certification, etc. and essential physical capabilities (e.g. lifting, assisting lifting, standing, etc.)*

· Masters of Social Work from an institution accredited by the Council on Social Work Education (CSWE) or its equivalent; and

· Knowledge of medical terminology

· Understanding the roles of the healthcare team

· Exceptional interpersonal skills

· Written and verbal communication skills

· Strong crisis intervention skills

**Preferred Qualification Requirements** *(desired requirements beyond MQRs above)*

· LMSW or LCSW preferred

· Experience of community facilities and resources for discharge planning

\\* Bilingual Spanish a plus

**Salary**: $58K annually; pro-rated salary for less than 40 hours per week Part-Time

**Locations:** 

* **Bronx - 3060 East Tremont Ave**

Premier is unique in its quality of medical, dental, mental health, rehabilitation, and specialty care provided to people with disabilities and their families. With medical professionals and physicians affiliated with major hospitals in the New York metropolitan area, Premier has practices conveniently located in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, and Queens.

Premier HealthCare fosters a culture of interdisciplinary collaboration, ongoing opportunities for professional development, and a positive work environment with supportive supervision. Premier is technology and outcomes driven.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or status as a Vietnam or disabled veteran. YAI is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Molecular Biologist/Scientist
description:
Duties: Looking for a highly motivated functional genomics and sequencing scientist to contribute to the growth of our new Functional Genomics and Sequencing Laboratory (FGSL). The FGSL scientist will contribute their expertise to the new FGSL and will collaborate with scientist from our local Therapeutic Areas (TAs) including Immunology and Respiratory, Cancer Immunology and Immune Modulation, CardioMetabolic Disease and will partner with Computational Biology and Data Sciences (CBDS) to deliver data to advance the portfolio. Responsibilities include but are not limited to implementing new experimental designs that contribute to core group/research goals.

Duties & Responsibilities

· Design/develop/perform various functional genomics assays, such as CRISPR pool screening, bulk RNA-seq, single cell–seq, spatial transcriptomics, CITE-seq, WES, Perturb-seq and 10X Multiome on tissue, cell or nuclei suspensions; · Assist with technical guidance and training, as appropriate, to Research scientists a) in FGSL technologies and techniques and b) to conduct assays, troubleshoot and solve technical issues; · Serve as scientific monitor for assay performance and project management at external CROs; · Documents and maintains detailed laboratory records in accordance with SOP's and policies; · Operates and maintains lab equipment in collaboration with other lab members; · Assists with budget preparation and acquisition of necessary supplies and equipment; · Defines and performs appropriate QC measures; · Follows relevant scientific literature to ensure use of optimal methods and understand emerging practices across the field; · Demonstrates the ability to interpret the outcome of experiments, propose appropriate follow-up, and may propose new avenues of investigation; · Communicates own work effectively orally and in writing; contributes to writing protocols, procedures, and technical reports · Automate processing and results reporting and delivery; · Reports and treats data with a high level of integrity and ethics.

Skills: Requirements

· Demonstrated experience with CRISPR assays · Demonstrated experience with next-generation sequencing (NGS) and functional genomics, single cell technologies; · Proficient in cell culture.

· Experience in automation and software programing is a plus; · Able to perform variety of FGS experimental techniques at the same time; · Demonstrated experience working in a multi-disciplinary and collaborative environment; · Ability to troubleshoot FGS experiments both individually and as part of a team.

· Excellent oral and written skills with the ability to communicate in an open, transparent, timely and consistent manner.

Keywords:

Education: Ph.D. or Master's degree from an accredited institution with 6+ years of experience in molecular, cell biology, or related scientific discipline.

Skills and Experience:

Required Skills:

CELL CULTURE

Languages:

English

Read

Write

Speak

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $50.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you have experience in CRISPR assays ?
* Do you have Experience in cell culture ?
* Do you have Experience in automation and software programing ?
* Are you Able to perform variety of FGS experimental techniques at the same time?

title: Chief of Hospital Police Level 3
description:
The Chief of Hospital Police serves at the discretion of the Chief Operating Officer. This individual will be responsible for the security of the entire campus, including the safety and security Of the staff, patients, visitors, and other guests. They be responsible for implementing protocols designed to prevent property damage and loss. They will manage hospital police and security personnel consisting of uniformed personnel and civilian administrators. Additional responsibilities of the Chief of Hospital Police include but are not limited to:

* Participate in Relevant Committees: o Environment of Care
* Create and submit the Security Management Plan annually.
* Complete the Security Management Plan Annual review.
* Issue reports and disseminate information as required, requested or directed.
* Workplace Violence Prevention Committee o Hospital Police Chiefs Council
* Any other gathering as required, requested, or directed by Bellevue's Chief Operating Officer and Chief Executive Officer, or the Systemwide Chief Security Officer.
* Security and Hospital Police Policy:
* Review and revise written protocols as necessary and at least every two years.
* Create new protocols as required, requested or directed.
* Communicate policy changes efficiently and effectively.
* Monitor or have monitored the effectiveness of all policies and procedures.
* Hospital Policy and Procedure:
* Participate in review committees that review and revise existing protocols.
* Create new protocols as required, requested, or directed.
* Distribute revised and/or newly created protocols as required, requested or directed.
* Investigate or Have Investigated:
* Complaints and allegations of misconduct against any uniformed or non-uniformed employee assigned to the hospital police department.
* Complaints and allegations of a sensitive nature.
* Complaints or allegations of any kind as reported by any person.
* Workplace Violence Prevention:
* Ensure that all incidents of violence in the workplace are documented properly.
* Ensure that workplace violence risk assessments are conducted on all units on all floors.
* Train hospital staff on workplace violence prevention.
* Initiate, facilitate, and manage all investigations into reports of workplace violence.
* Create and support workplace violence prevention strategies.
* Liaison with New York State Public Employee Safety & Health (NYS PESH) as required, requested or directed.

Qualifications:

1. New York State residency (for the duration of employment); and  
2. Completion of the NYC Health + Hospitals Chief of Hospital Police in service training within six (6) months of appointment; and  
3. Possession of a valid New York State motor vehicle driver’s license (Note: This license must be maintained for the duration of employment); and  
4. Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in Criminal Justice, Security Management, Security Administration or a related discipline, and four (4) years of full-time, paid work experience in law enforcement or a security-related position, two (2) years of which must have been in a managerial or supervisory capacity; or  
5. Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Criminal Justice, Security Management, Security Administration or a related discipline, and five (5) years of full-time, paid work experience in law enforcement or security-related field, three (3) years of which must have been in a managerial or supervisory capacity; or  
6. A satisfactory equivalent of education and/or experience where one (1) year of full–time, paid work experience in law enforcement or security in a managerial or supervisory capacity equates to 30 college credits. However, all candidates must have a minimum of two (2) years of experience in law enforcement or security in a managerial or supervisory capacity; New York State residency; and a valid New York State motor vehicle driver’s license. In addition, the NYC Health + Hospitals Chief of Hospital Police in service training must be completed within six (6) months of appointment.

title: T-Mobile Neighborhood Retail Assistant Manager (North Plainfield)
description:
**Chase #LimitlessPotential at GP Mobile, an Authorized T-Mobile Retailer!**

**GP Mobile, is one of the largest Authorized T-Mobile Retailers in the US!**

**Seeking candidates with a hustle and ambition for unlimited potential.** 

**If you want to earn unlimited commissions while working in a fun, fast-paced environment, GP Mobile is the place to be! We have FT and PT positions available.** 

**Se prefieren hablantes bilingües de español, pero no se requieren.**

**Why Join Our Team? #LimitlessPotential #CareerGrowth #ConnectedCulture**

**Be unstoppable with us!**

**Job Overview**

The Retail Associate Manager works in partnership with the Store Manager to lead and develop the store team to deliver T-Mobile’s aspirations of earning a place in our customers’ hearts and Mobile Associate success.

**Job Responsibilities:**

· Responsible for infusing every store’s Mobile Associate s with a passion for T-Mobile’s Manifesto by thoroughly orienting and grounding them to a standard of Loving Our Customers.

· Ensure that every need the customer has, when coming into the store, is met and that employees build the customer’s confidence by making their experience comfortable, simple and by solving the whole problem.

· Complete observations of Mobile Associate s’ interactions with customers, including feedback, to be used in development, training & coaching conversations.

· Effectively manage customer wait time. Keep current on products, services, and promotions.

· Lead by example, staying up to date on the latest products, services, training, and leadership best practices to remain an expert resource to the team. Interact directly with Mobile Associate s to ensure they meet and/or exceed defined, monthly success measurements completing assigned training on time.

· Assist in maintaining the quality of the overall store environment and adhere to national plan-o-gram standards. Use visual displays and interactive devices effectively. Keep visual displays and devices current. Assist in the execution of Retail Methods & Procedures.

· Ensure team knowledge of store systems. Ensure that teams are knowledgeable about corporate and store communications. Deliver financial results based on key performance indicators. Identify ways to manage and control store expenses. Manage discounting and credits.

**The experience you’ll bring:**

· 1 year customer service and/or sales experience, retail environment preferred

· Available to work a varied schedule including nights, weekends, and holidays

· Ability to lead and mentor people to deliver great results

· Outstanding communicator with ability to interact with teammates and customers

**What’s in it for you:**

· Competitive base pay, plus commissions

· Benefits for part-time and full-time employees

· Medical, dental and vision benefits

· Generous paid time-off programs

· Phone service discounts

· Serious growth potential for your career

This is the opportunity to do something special and join a company revolutionizing the wireless industry. And we couldn’t do it without someone like you. So, what do you say? Isn’t it time you explored what could become the career move of a lifetime?

**We invite you to apply today!**

**Requirements:**

· At least 18 years of age

· Legally authorized to work in the United States

· High School Diploma or GED

#NeverStopGrowing

GP Mobile doesn’t have a corporate ladder–it’s more like a jungle gym of possibilities! We love helping our employees grow in their careers, because it’s that shared drive to aim high that drives our business and our culture forward.

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At GP Mobile we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

At GP Mobile, A T-Mobile Premium Retailer, we strongly encourage everyone, including people of color, veterans, military spouses, individuals with disabilities, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, and parents to apply. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome everyone to our team.

title: Direct Support Professional
description:
***Overview***   
We seek a compassionate and dedicated Direct Support Professional to join our team. This role is essential in providing high-quality support and care to individuals with developmental disabilities, ensuring their well-being, and promoting their independence. The ideal candidate will have a strong commitment to resident rights and the ability to implement care plans effectively.

***"THOSE WHO ARE THE HAPPIEST ARE THOSE WHO DO FOR OTHERS"***

Ark Homecare Inc. was established in 2017, with the sole purpose of providing quality in-home care for individuals with developmental disabilities. Over time, Ark Homecare Inc. has expanded to having 3 Adult Day Program Centers, catering to numerous counties across New Jersey. Our foundation was built on respect, community, and integration. As we continue to grow we stand firm on our actions towards making a change in other lives.

Our commitment to providing exceptional customer service extends throughout the workplace, amid a supportive environment of open communication and trust. We also provide several training opportunities, enabling staff to advance their skill sets and further develop their careers.

* Ark Homecare Inc. is currently seeking candidates to train as our Direct Care Professionals for its surrounding areas such as Bergan, Essex, Hudson, Mercer, Middlesex, Monmouth, Morris, Somerset, and Union Counties. In this vital role, you will be responsible for the caring and well-being of the individuals attending our day program between the hours of 8:00 am- 4:00 pm.

***Requirements Are:***

* High school diploma or GED
* Six months of experience with the DDD population
* Must be 18 years of age
* Must have a valid State of New Jersey driver's license
* Must be able to read and write english
* Ability to follow verbal and written directions of supervisors, program plans, behavior plans, medical/medication instructions, etc.
* Ability to complete and maintain all training
* Demonstrated ability/understanding of basic life safety topics relevant to individuals' well-being (CPR, Danielle’s Law and first aid skills, fire safety, etc)

***Certificates, Licenses and Registrations:*** 

* Shift Expectations
* Abuse and Neglect
* Behavioral Management
* Medication Administration
* CPR
* First Aid
* CDS Online
* Must pass the agency physical, drug screening, and background check
* Must complete and pass the OSHA training

***Bloodborne Pathogen Category:*** 

The job requires the performance of duties that involve the potential for exposure of blood, body fluids, or tissues. Tasks that do involve these items are an expectation of employment.

***Join our multicultural team and assist us in empowering and rehabilitating adults with disabilities and behavioral health challenges.***

title: Manager, Data & Platform Solutions
description:
**Company Description**  

Zenith is a full-service media agency with capabilities and expertise across all channels and disciplines. Zenith is part of Publicis Media, the #1 media buying network in the Americas and #2 globally. As “The ROI Agency,” Zenith’s expertise lies in driving real, tangible business outcomes, not just media metrics, that will have a measurable effect on our clients’ business. Every investment we make has an ROI mindset—not just for our clients, but for our agency at large. We’re focused on driving the maximum value for our people, our capabilities and our media investments for some of the world’s leading brands.

 **Job Description**  

The Data and Platform Solutions teams is a team of experts that help to deliver better marketing decisions using data, and apply expertise in how audience data can help impact a client’s business. Working closely with the media planning, investment, and analytics teams we translate client goals and objectives into actionable data using internal agency or external client technologies such as DSPs, RMNs, and CDPs. Our team goals are to educate on uses of data, drive innovation in the data and tech space, partner with analytics to create test plans, generate key insights and profiles to align with strategic planning, and maximize value of our client partnerships.


The Manager of Data & Platform Solutions is an entry-level management role that will specifically be responsible for audience profiling, activating of audience data, and managing the technology platforms that drive better marketing decisions in partnership with the media team. This highly motivated, detail-oriented individual manages processes around targeting data, generates reports to understand key insights, and overall executes on the client’s investments in data and their technology stack.


The successful candidate is a curious problem solver with a knack for telling stories through data.  



Role Objectives:

* Manage day-to-day operations in platforms, like a DMP, CDP, and DSP
* Execute on audience data to impact media strategies for client account(s)
* Manage the process of defining and validating audiences to be targeted, sharing data with partners, and tracking and compiling performance reports regarding audience groups
* Mine category and brand data that will uncover insights that will drive business results
* Integrate and work in partnership with client research, insights and analytics teams to make data a cornerstone for smarter planning
* Act as internal resource to demonstrate agency knowledge of data strategies and communicate complex concepts to a non-technical audience
* Help answer client questions, create client-ready presentations, and present at client meetings
* Support and/or manage writing of media deliverables (timelines, POVs, RFPs, presentations, etc.)
* Maintain knowledge of current Ad & MarTech media trends

  

**Qualifications**  

* 3+ years of experience preferred in digital media Investment, ad technology, or ad operations
* Self-starter who is quick to learn and eager to contribute
* Naturally curious and thrives in environments that require out-of-the-box thinking
* Excellent interpersonal, verbal, written communication, and presentation skills
* Experience managing multiple, competing priorities, duties and/or projects with the ability to work independently and in a team setting.
* Familiarity with basic accounting/math principles; basic statistical analysis experience is a plus
* Expertise in both digital and offline media planning, across all channels, with the deep understanding of latest and emerging buying models (retail or commerce experience a plus)
* Experience with multiple methodological approaches for consumer brand insight (social listening, syndicated tools, primary research)
* Demonstrated ability to work with large data sets

  

**Additional Information**  

Compensation Range: $95,000 - $100,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 9/16/2024.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Corporate Healthcare Regulatory Attorney
description:
As a key member of the Corporate team, you will be responsible for providing expert legal counsel and acting as the primary point of contact for all matters related to healthcare regulations, specifically focusing on the Stark Law, Anti-Kickback Statute, Corporate practice doctrines, and related laws and regulations. This role is vital in supporting and shaping the success of our growing national dental and veterinary practices. Join us in our pursuit of excellence and contribute your exceptional talent to help drive our Corporate practice area to new heights.

**Responsibilities:**

* Drive strategy and risk mitigation for a wide range of regulatory and compliance legal issues.
* Work closely with various cross-functional departments to ensure effective risk management and compliance.
* Monitor and ensure ongoing compliance with healthcare, dental, and veterinary regulations; possess the ability to interpret and communicate complex legal requirements.
* Train, educate, and provide strategic guidance to the client’s business teams and leaders on legal issues relating to healthcare regulatory compliance.
* Offer strategic guidance to client business teams and leaders on navigating complex legal issues related to healthcare regulations.

**Qualifications:**

* Juris Doctor (JD) degree from an accredited law school.
* Minimum of 10+ years of relevant experience as an attorney, with a focus on healthcare regulations and compliance.
* Must be admitted to the NJ Bar; NY Bar admission is a plus
* Strong familiarity with healthcare laws and regulations, particularly related to the Stark Law, Anti-Kickback Statute, Medicare policy, and corporate practice doctrines.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and meet strict deadlines.
* Demonstrated commercial and business acumen with a track record of delivering creative and pragmatic solutions and advice.
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, and writing skills.
* Intrinsically motivated, a self-starter, entrepreneurial mindset, and a proactive and self-directed approach to problem-solving.

title: Head of Marketing
description:
**We are** a venture-backed, knowledge automation tech company with a cutting edge, AI driven, SaaS platform to automate the right answers for the people that need them most.


**Our platform** plugs into a company’s content systems, learns from the data, and then helps employees respond to queries without hunting for information. Without Shelf, the average worker currently spends 19% of their time tracking down answers, and COVID-19 made it worse.


**Our goal** is to turn every customer service representative into a super-agent by helping them find answers to questions instantly. We provide immediate Day 1 ROI for some of the world’s top brands and enterprises right now.


**Our mission** is to empower humanity with better answers everywhere and our vision goes far beyond solutions for contact centers.



**Job Description:**



The Head of Marketing will drive Shelf revenue, GTM strategy, demand generation, and brand awareness to promote the growth of our Knowledge Management platform. Our platform combines AI with modern SaaS infrastructure and a simple user experience to help agents and customers get the answers they need–on-demand.



The Head of Marketing will lead and direct Shelf’s brand and marketing strategies, they’ll set and achieve targets, and establish relationships with the media and clients. In addition, this person will have a proven track record of being a keen multitasker and who thrives in a competitive environment. Outstanding candidates have extensive experience developing brand and marketing strategies for new products within a SaaS driven environment or innovative technology start-up. The Head of Marketing must be able to make recommendations about marketing strategies, to the C-Suite, and action those strategies expeditiously in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.



The goal is to optimize and amplify a best-in-class, impactful and innovative marketing operation that takes Shelf from our recent $50M B-round to C, D, IPO, and beyond. We are interested in intellectually curious, motivated people who have a growth mindset and get energized each day to seize a massive opportunity. If this sounds like you, come and join us!


**What We’re Looking For:**


* Drive demand for Shelf across all digital channels at every stage of the buyer journey.
* Accelerate Shelf growth through creative and effective digital marketing and ABM campaigns that create new sales pipelines and drive expansion revenue.
* Develop a deep understanding of ideal customer profile roles, needs, motivations, and purchase processes for each Shelf target market.
* Experiment, optimize and scale digital marketing programs, including the shelf website, PPC, SEO, advertising, email, chat, and social to increase engagement, conversion, and ROI.
* Build and manage world class marketing operations. Oversee all Shelf marketing websites, databases, automation tools, integrations, and management reporting.
* Deploy state-of-the-art marketing metrics, including full funnel multi-touch attribution, to instill understanding of marketing impact and accountability across the entire marketing organization.
* Work closely with sales, field marketing, community marketing, product marketing, partner marketing, content marketing and corporate marketing to execute integrated marketing campaigns across specific segments, channels, and regions.massive opportunity.
* Partner Management: Create enablement materials, attend and host webinars, participate in events, and develop product one-pagers to enhance partner relationships and drive success.
* Event Management: Oversee booth design, swag design and management, create and run promotions, and the creation of support materials to ensure impactful and memorable event experiences.
* Analyst Management: Lead analyst pitches, coordinate vendor briefings, manage the MQL wave, and maintain strong analyst relations to effectively position Shelf within the market.


If you are a highly motivated individual with a proven track record of success and a passion for driving the adoption of innovative knowledge management solutions and AI technology, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join our team and play a pivotal role in accelerating the growth of Shelf, empowering organizations to unlock the full potential of their knowledge assets.If this sounds like you, come and join us!


**What You Bring:**


* Demonstrated expertise generating digital demand across all online media.
* Deep strategic enterprise SaaS marketing experience and expertise.
* Strong technical acumen and broad knowledge of internet marketing technologies.
* Proven ability to manage people effectively, fostering a collaborative and supportive team environment.
* Experience in building and optimizing processes to streamline marketing operations and drive efficiency.
* Ability to understand and analyze metrics effectively to track performance, identify trends, and optimize marketing efforts.
* Deep experience sharing those metrics with the C-Suite in a way that helps drive strategic decisions regarding the overall marketing function of Shelf.
* Adaptive and open to change, with the ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
* Bachelor’s degree required in Marketing; MBA a plus.


**Why You'll Love Working With Us:**


* **We believe in excellence and we make each other better.**
* **We learn from our mistakes and we come back stronger.**
* **We’re curious, and we love to learn from one another.**
* **We’re accountable to each other.**
* **Innovative Culture:** We're always pushing the envelope and looking for new ways to grow and improve. You'll be part of a forward-thinking team that values creativity and innovation.
* **Impactful Work:** Your work will have a direct impact on our company's success and the well-being of our employees. You'll be making a difference every day.


**What We Offer:**


* Competitive starting salary, with additional bonus opportunities (based on team and individual investment performance)
* Generous equity grant in the form of company stock options
* Comprehensive health, wellness, benefit packages


**Location:**



Stamford, CT


**Why Shelf:**


* According to MarketWatch in November 2022, the global knowledge management market size was valued at US$405 Billion in 2021 and is expected to expand at a CAGR of 18.12% during the forecast period, reaching US$1.1 Trillion by 2027
* Our Leadership Team has deep knowledge management and AI domain expertise and enterprise SaaS background to execute this plan
* We have raised over $60 million in funding and our investors include Tiger Global, Insight Partners, Connecticut Innovations, and others
* Our platform has been consistently rated #1 for overall usability by Gartner Digital Markets, and has received Easiest to Use, Easiest to Admin, and Highest Adoption awards from G2., and product of the year and innovation awards from leading publications, such as CIO Review.
* We have high velocity growth powered by the most innovative product in our category, 3X growth for 3 years in a row
* We now have over 100 employees in multiple U.S. states and European countries, and we have ambitious hiring goals over the next few months

title: Education Director
description:

The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership skills and a commitment to fostering an engaging and inclusive learning environment. This role requires a strategic thinker who can manage educational administration while ensuring the highest standards of curriculum development and student engagement. \\*Responsibilities\\* - Develop and implement educational programs that align with organizational goals and standards. - Supervise and support educational staff, providing guidance and professional development opportunities. - Manage budgets related to educational initiatives, ensuring effective allocation of resources. - Collaborate with senior leadership to establish long-term educational strategies and objectives. - Engage in fundraising efforts to support educational programs and initiatives. - Oversee curriculum development, ensuring it meets the needs of diverse learners. - Foster relationships with students, parents, and community stakeholders to enhance educational offerings. - Monitor and evaluate program effectiveness, making necessary adjustments for continuous improvement. \\*Experience\\* - Proven experience in education administration, with a strong background in leadership roles. - Demonstrated ability to manage teams effectively while supervising staff in an educational setting. - Experience working directly with students, understanding their needs and challenges in the learning environment. - Strong skills in budgeting and resource management within an educational context. - Familiarity with fundraising strategies to support educational initiatives is highly desirable. - Expertise in curriculum development that promotes student engagement and achievement is essential. Join us in shaping the future of education by applying your skills as an Education Director!

title: Bilingual (SPANISH) Paralegal - Immigration EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
description:
Soto Law is a fast-growing, bilingual law firm specializing in personal injury and immigration matters. We are seeking a Bilingual Spanish speaking Legal Secretary in our White Plains, NY office.

The position requires attention to detail, responsiveness with clients and understanding of how to fill out immigration forms, motions, and correspondence.

Previous work experience as a legal assistant or a paralegal is a must. We want someone who is dedicated to helping immigrants in this difficult legal process, as well as passionate about their career in the legal field.

You must be able to understand the basics of computer softwares such as: Microsoft Office and Google. You must also be able to handle several different databases of information. You must work with urgency and treat each new case with care. If you aren’t 100% confident managing data and people, you are not the right person for this job.

Other requirements include the following:

* Knowledge on preparing all family immigration applications to include but not limited to: I-589, I-765, I-130, I-485, I-601, I-918, I-192, and other applications as necessary;
* Knowledge of filing motions to reopen and reconsider with USCIS ;
* Knowledge of filing applications with USCIS;
* Knowledge of the organization and composition of business letters, minutes, reports and numerical and tabular materials;
* Knowledge of correct English and Spanish language usage, spelling, punctuation and legal terminology;
* Ability to multitask independently and demonstrate sound judgment;
* Attention to detail;
* Ability to speak to clients in a professional and caring manner;
* Knowledge of basic google applications: Docs, Sheets, Calendar;
* Knowledge of basic Microsoft Office software;
* Ability to follow instructions;
* Ability to handle the stress associated with management of cases and meet deadlines;
* Ability to communicate effectively;
* Ability to transcribe documents from written oral or computer generated formats;

We provide training, and for the right person, this will be a highly rewarding position. If this sounds like a good fit for you, please complete the process below to be considered.

HOW TO APPLY:

Apply on Indeed and send a message with the following

Subject Line: Immigration Paralegal WP

In the body of the e-mail, answer the following questions:

Why did you become a paralegal and what is your knowledge in immigration law?

What are you looking for in a job and why do you think you would be a good fit for this firm.

***Qualifications:***

* Bachelor’s Degree or Paralegal Degree or ABA-approved Paralegal Certificate and 2+ years of law firm experience, although exceptional candidates with less experience will be considered.
* High degree of ethics, integrity, and professionalism.
* Strong organizational, communication and interpersonal skills.

Experience:

* Microsoft Office: 5 years (Preferred)
* Paralegal: 3 years (Preferred)

Language:

* Spanish (Required)
* Results oriented with strong time and project management skills and able to multitask and meet tight deadlines.

Pay: starting at $44,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Paid time off
* 401k

Travel requirement:

* No travel

title: Graphic Designer/Customer Service Representative
description:
**About Us:**

We are a small but fast-growing e-commerce business specializing in personalized gifts. Our passion is creating unique, custom-made items that bring joy to our customers. We’re looking for a multi-talented individual who can bring creativity and care to both our designs and our customers.

**Job Overview:**

As a **Graphic Designer & Customer Service Representative**, you will play a dual role in our team. You’ll create and edit digital designs for our personalized products, such as custom mugs, t-shirts, and more. In addition, you’ll be the face of our customer support, helping customers with their inquiries, orders, and any issues they may have . If you’re someone who can combine creativity with customer care, this is the perfect role for you!

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Graphic Design & Photo Editing:**
* Design custom digital graphics for personalized products.
* Edit photos and optimize them for print and web.
* Ensure designs meet customer specifications and product guidelines.
* Create trendy, innovative designs for new product lines to keep our offerings fresh and on-trend.
* **Customer Service:**
* Respond to customer inquiries via email and/or e-commerce chats in a timely and professional manner.
* Assist customers with product personalization, order updates, and troubleshooting.
* Handle returns, refunds, and exchanges in line with company policies.
* Provide proactive communication and follow-up to ensure customer satisfaction.

**Qualifications:**

* **Graphic Design Skills:** Proficiency in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator
* **Photo Editing Experience:** Ability to retouch, enhance, and prepare photos for print.
* **Customer Service Experience:** Strong interpersonal skills with a focus on customer satisfaction.
* **Communication:** Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* **Multi-tasking Ability:** Must be able to manage design projects while handling customer inquiries.
* **Attention to Detail:** Accuracy in both design work and customer interactions.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience in e-commerce or a related field.
* Familiarity with Amazon, Etsy, Shopify, or other e-commerce platforms.

**How to Apply:**  
Please submit your resume, a portfolio of your design work (if available, its a plus), and a brief cover letter outlining why you’d be a great fit for this role.

This role is ideal for someone who enjoys both creative work and customer interaction, and wants to grow with a dynamic e-commerce business!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 – 50 per week

title: Office Admin / Office Liaison
description:
Are you an organized, detail-oriented professional looking to pave your career own career path in luxury commercial and residential remodeling? Essential Remodeling, a high-end remodeling company in New York City, is seeking an **Office Liaison** to join our dynamic team. If you have excellent communication skills and thrive in a fast-paced environment, this may be the perfect role for you.

**Office Liaison Responsibilities**

**Procurement & Order Management:**

* Monitor the internal ordering email and manage procurement processes.
* Manage all material and supply orders for ongoing projects.
* Update and maintain the client expense report for projects.
* Act as a liaison between the office, project managers, and subcontractors for procurement-related matters.
* Ensure timely delivery of materials to job sites by overseeing procurement and delivery schedules.
* Track all purchases and deliveries, manage delivery schedules, and upload tracking information to client folders.
* Prioritize tasks effectively for multiple ongoing projects.

**Project Documentation & Communication:**

* Assist in maintaining and updating project documentation on BuilderTrend (our project software).
* Upload all purchases and relevant project files to designated client folders.
* Manage the printing and pickup of plans, permits, and other project-related documents.

**DOB (Department of Buildings) Approvals:**

* Assist with preparing and submitting applications for DOB approvals.
* Coordinate with our expeditor, Head of Office, and architect to meet building and permit requirements.
* Request and track the status of permits and approvals, working closely with the Head of Office to ensure timely processing.

**Client & Vendor Communication:**

* Maintain a positive, professional attitude when interacting with vendors and clients, ensuring clear and effective communication.

**Administrative Support:**

* Provide administrative support to the Head of Office, managing schedules and communications as needed.
* Upload, organize, and maintain project files to ensure accuracy and completeness.

**Compliance & Reporting:**

* Ensure that all project documents, permits, and records are properly filed and updated.
* Monitor compliance with OSHA, DOB, and other industry regulations.
* Assist with generating accounting reports for internal use and client records.

**Office Management:**

* Occasionally assist with coordinating office-wide in-person meetings.

**Qualifications:**

* Proven experience in an administrative or office management role, preferably within the construction or remodeling industry.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize efficiently.
* Proficiency in project management software, ideally BuilderTrend.
* Familiarity with DOB permits and approvals (preferred).
* Basic understanding of OSHA regulations and industry compliance standards (preferred).
* Jack or Jane of all trades. We are a small fast-moving and growing company with plenty of room to move into or gain more responsibilities.

**Why Join Us?**

At Essential Remodeling, we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional luxury remodeling services to our clients. We offer a collaborative work environment where every team member’s contribution is valued. If you are looking to be part of a growing company and play a key role in the success of high-end projects, we encourage you to apply.

**To apply**, please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your experience and qualifications.

*Note - This is a hybrid role. We have all-hands meetings in-person a couple of times a week but you may work from home. We do plan on getting an office space soon and will require more time to be in office.* 

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $52,000.00 - $56,000.00 per year

* Weekends as needed

title: Dental Assistant
description:
**Job Overview**

Job description

**Job Title**: Dental Assistant

**Company:**

**Location:**

**About Us**:

We are a full-service state of the art dental practice that specializes in all areas of dentistry, conveniently located in the heart of Downtown Manhattan. Our goal is to provide our patients with high-quality dental care with our cutting-edge dental technology. We are currently seeking a dynamic and experienced Dental Assistant to support our dental team and ensure the smooth and efficient treatment to our patients.

**Job Description:**

As a Dental Assistant at NSD, you will play a vital role in supporting our dental team and providing high-quality care to our patients. Your primary responsibilities will include:

* Assisting the dentist during dental procedures, including fillings, extractions, crowns, and root canals, by preparing the treatment area, passing instruments, and providing chairside assistance.
* Taking and developing dental X-rays, intraoral photographs, and impressions for study models, ensuring accuracy and adherence to safety protocols.
* Sterilizing and maintaining dental instruments and equipment in accordance with infection control guidelines and regulatory standards.
* Preparing and organizing dental materials, supplies, and medications needed for patient care and treatment procedures.
* Educating patients on proper oral hygiene techniques, post-operative care instructions, and preventive dental measures to promote oral health and wellness.
* Providing compassionate chairside support to patients, addressing their concerns, and ensuring their comfort throughout their dental visit.
* Performing administrative tasks, such as updating patient records, scheduling appointments, and processing billing and insurance claims as needed.
* Collaborating closely with the dental team to coordinate patient care and ensure smooth workflow in the dental office.

**Requirements**:

* Completion of a dental assisting program from an accredited institution or equivalent training and experience.
* X-ray certification and CPR certification preferred.
* Previous experience working as a dental assistant in a family or cosmetic dentistry practice is highly desirable.
* Proficiency in dental software systems and basic computer skills.
* Knowledge of dental terminology, procedures, and infection control protocols.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with an ***engaging compassionate and patient-centered approach*** to care.
* Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask in a fast-paced clinical environment.
* Professional demeanor and ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism in handling patient information.
* Commitment to upholding the highest standards of ethics, integrity, and professionalism in dental practice.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary ranging from $20 per hour to $25 per hour based on experience.
* Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the practice.
* Positive and supportive work environment with a focus on teamwork and collaboration.
* Rewarding career helping patients achieve healthy and beautiful smiles.

Join our team at Nassau Street Dental and become a valued member of our compassionate and dedicated dental family. If you are passionate about providing exceptional patient care and are ready to make a difference in the lives of others, we encourage you to apply for the Dental Assistant position today!

title: Business Office Director
description:
**Arbor Terrace Mountainside** is an award-winning senior living community in Mountainside, NJ offering award winning Assisted Living and Dementia care from The Arbor Company.

We have an exceptional opportunity for a seasoned financial leader to contribute to a team of caring and compassionate employees and help us maintain the traditions of excellence in our community. The **Business Office Director's** responsibilities include all business and office management functions of the community. Specific responsibilities include billing, A/R, payables, and payroll. The **Business Office Director** also manages processes related to Human Resources such as hiring, onboarding, and oversight of compliance with ongoing training systems. As a valued member of the community's leadership team, the Business Office Manager helps set a tone of professionalism and caring for residents, their families, and our staff.

**Preferred Background:**

* Associate or bachelor's degree in business, accounting, or related field
* Three to five years of financial management experience, preferably in a senior living setting
* Familiarity with monthly P&L and departmental spend downs
* Strong organization and follow-through skills.
* Engaging verbal and written communication style.
* Good mentoring and coaching skills; ability to inspire and develop others.
* Proficient computer skills with all windows applications and accounting systems.
* Experience with staff management including hiring, training, and scheduling

**The Arbor Company**, based in Atlanta, GA, manages more than 40 senior living communities in eleven states with more in the pipeline. In business for over 30 years, we have established a national reputation as a leader in senior care—independent living, assisted living, and memory care. We are a fast-paced and growing company that thrives on a culture of deep mutual respect and accountability. The tenure of our executive team, including community-based leaders, is exceptional. We are dedicated to the seniors we serve, their families, and to each other. Our culture is unparalleled and a terrific fit for self-motivated, creative, and dedicated leaders with a passion for senior care.

description:
The **Born Brand Group**, headquartered in Greenwich CT, manufactures and markets trend comfort footwear under the brand names Born, Kork-Ease, B.O.C. and Korks. This position is a full-time in office role.

**Financial Planning Manager Responsibilities:**

* Work closely with Key Account Sales Managers to manage businesses with key retail accounts.

* Create buy plans for key accounts and be able to assist with the sell in and execution of them.
* Travel to accounts as needed to review business as well as attend relevant trade shows to assist in the sell-in of seasonal programs.
* Analyze historical retailer sales data and current trends to identify risks and opportunities.
* Project and track season-end gross margin, calculating potential liabilities on a quarterly basis. This includes analyzing financial data, forecasting performance, and ensuring accurate and timely delivery of reports to the leadership team.

o Communicate with internal business partners (including design, sourcing, etc.) major changes in business strategy and account needs.

* Work closely with Corporate Merchandising team to plan, analyze and project inventory levels needed to drive results.
* Create and manage seasonal projection templates working with sales leaders to garner accurate levels of interest in new seasonal offerings.

o Create, analyze and manage appropriate replenishment bulk programs for key retail partners.

· Work closely with Corporate Merchandising team and Internal Digital Commerce team to plan, analyze and project optimal inventory levels for both our branded websites as well as our third party drop ship partnerships.

* Coordinate digital assets (images, details, copy) with Marketing team and deliver to key accounts as needed to ensure new deliveries are available on retailer’s e-comm site in a timely manner.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree with 5+ years of relevant work experience.
* Strong understanding of retail math and retail planning principles.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize and meet deadlines.
* Advanced skills in Excel required (v-lookups, pivot tables, complex formulas)
* Working knowledge of MS office, Acrobat, Teams, web-based file sharing programing as well as an ability to quickly get familiarized with navigation of key partner vendor portals.
* Strong interpersonal skills that will drive the ability to build the trust of teammates and account partners.
* Superior communication skills; able to communicate persuasively, influentially and responsibly.

title: Direct Care Counselor
description:
**Job Brief**
-------------



Provides care for individuals with developmental disabilities who reside in Agency’s residential program.



Shift Worked:
**10:00PM-6:15AM**
Weekly Hours:
**30**
FLSA Status:
**Non Exempt**
Pay range:
**$18.90 - $19.25**

**POSITION SUMMARY:**



Performs ADL duties for individuals such as: bathing, dressing, toileting, grooming, preparing meals, and lifting or transferring to/from various surfaces. Performs general housekeeping duties to maintain the cleanliness and safety of the residence. Administers medications and topicals according to doctors’ orders and under the direction of a nurse. Implements individualized program plans and maintains records and charts as needed. Accompanies individuals in community inclusionary activities, medical appointments and all other applicable activities.


**POSITION DUTIES:**



* Assists individuals with activities of daily living; including toileting and changing adult diapers, lifting/transferring, showering, grooming, oral hygiene, meal programs, and dressing.


* Participates in in-house recreational activities and responsible for accompanying individuals to community-based activities.


* Participates as a member of the interdisciplinary team and assists in evaluating and implementing goals/outcomes. Actively implements individual programs by following prescribed methodology. Regularly communicates and relays pertinent information to clinicians, supervisors, co-workers and other appropriate agency personnel.


* Maintains records, charts, and logs for each individual by entering required information (changes in behavior, goal progress/data collection, community inclusion, fire drills, vital signs, blood pressure readings, blood sugar readings, bowel regimens, etc.).


* Maintains records for residence, including cash journals, ledgers, medication counts, and residence logs. Follows appropriate protocols for tracking funds, medications, personal possessions etc. and notifies supervisor of any discrepancies.


* Prepares and serves meals for individuals by following individual’s prescribed menus and accompanying cooking instructions.


* Maintains cleanliness and safety of the residence and individuals’ possessions by performing general housekeeping tasks (washing floors and surfaces, laundering individuals’ clothes, dusting, making beds, cleaning cabinets, drawers, refrigerators, stoves, wheelchairs and adaptive equipment ).


* Administers medications and/or treatments, and records same. Relays pertinent information regarding medical and behavioral concerns to appropriate personnel. Ensures that the Clinic Visit Summary (CVS) accompanies the individual to his/her medical appointments.


* Ensures the well being and care of the individuals including appropriately using special equipment, responding to changes in conditions, participating and assisting in fire drills, etc.


* Accompanies individuals to medical appointments, outside programming, recreation programs, inclusionary activities etc. as required.


* Attends all required in-service training and staff meetings.


* Performs variety of miscellaneous duties as assigned, such as shopping for household supplies, and going to Pharmacy and Laundromat etc.



**ESSENTIAL PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:**



* The ability to coordinate the movement of the arms, legs, and torso together in activities where the whole body is in motion, including the ability to exert one’s self physically over long periods of time such as standing for two (2) plus hours at a time.


* The ability to safely lift individuals to/from various surfaces.


* The ability to safely perform a two (2) person transfer. Perform a stand pivot transfer with weight bearing individuals.


* The ability to lift and reach common objects such as laundry and nonperishable food items.


* The ability to push/pull, turn and maneuver equipment including occupied wheelchairs.


* Possess strength, coordination and agility to safely and quickly respond to emergency situations.


* The ability to bend, stretch, rotate, or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to ensure the safety of individuals in all situations.



**QUALIFICATIONS:**



* Must be able to understand and communicate in English.


* Must have a high school diploma or GED. Experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities preferred.


* Must demonstrate satisfactory completion of Cerebral Palsy Associations of New York State’s orientation training.


* Must demonstrate satisfactory completion of the Office for People with Developmental Disabilities (OPWDD) approved Medication Administration Course and Annual Medication Re-Certification.


* If an individual in an assigned residence requires specialized treatments/medications /procedures (ex.: g-tube feeding, insulin administration) must demonstrate satisfactory completion of a specialized course pertinent to the individual’s needs and obtain required certification and annual re-certification.


* Must be able to float to different sites according to established agency policy, regardless of location.


* Must be able to work overtime as needed.


* Performs all job responsibilities in full compliance with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, policies and procedures. Adheres to the agency’s corporate compliance program, including the code of business conduct, the NYS and federal false claims acts, whistleblower protections and mandatory reporting. Completes corporate compliance training at least annually. Fully cooperates in all corporate compliance investigations and reviews.



**MACHINES/EQUIPMENT OPERATED:**



* Washing Machine/Dryer


* Household Appliances


* Mechanical Lifter


* Various pieces of adaptive equipment (wheelchairs, walkers, bathroom equipment, splints, etc.)


* Office Equipment (includes Fax, Copier and Personal Computer)

title: Public Health Nutritionist
description:
The Westchester County Department of Senior Programs and Services has an immediate opening for a **Staff Nutritionist (RDN)**. The Nutrition Program provides meals and services for adults, 60 years and older. Meals are provided at congregate dining centers and by home delivery throughout Westchester County. Meals are available five or more days per week at approved nutrition sites and multi-purpose centers and to medically-eligible homebound seniors who are unable to participate at congregate sites.

The successful candidate is responsible for the implementation and monitoring of a comprehensive food service program for senior citizens in Westchester County. **This involves monitoring and assessing the delivery of services by subcontracting agencies and nutrition site managers to ensure conformance with standards established by the New York State and Westchester County Offices for the Aging, the New York State Department of Health, and provision (Title III Cl, C2, and WIN) of the Older Americans Act.**

**Additional Responsibilities Include but Not Limited to:** 

· Provide nutrition counselling or medical nutrition therapy guiding seniors to making healthy choices based on their medical conditions.

· Provide technical assistance and training to nutrition sites and caterers in all aspect of food service management and nutrition program standards including menu planning (Review, approve menus and complete nutrient analysis for recipes and menus), food purchasing contract and food preparation and storage. The meals are prepared locally and the menus change seasonally.

· Develop nutrition education and deliver educational presentations for congregate as well as homebound seniors receiving meals.

**Requirements:**

**Must have current registration as a Dietician by the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics and maintain same while in the title**.

A Bachelor's Degree in Nutrition, Dietetics, Nutrition Science, Foods and Nutrition or Institutional Food Management and 2 years’ experience as a public health nutritionist.

A Master’s Degree in Nutrition or Public Health Nutrition may be substituted for one year of the above stated experience.

**SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS**:

Valid NY State Driver’s License.

*This is a competitive class Civil Service title requiring examination.*

**COME JOIN OUR TEAM!**

Besides a competitive salary, our compensation package includes comprehensive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, deferred compensation, paid leave and retirement plan.

Please submit a cover letter and resume to kqdk@westchestercountyny.gov for consideration. Please indicate “**Staff Nutritionist – Senior Programs and Services**” in the subject line of your email.

**Westchester County is an Equal Opportunity Employer**

*About Westchester County*

*Westchester County, located in the heart of the historic Hudson Valley, covers 500 square miles and has a population of over one million. Originally home to Native Americans, who were members of the Lenape tribe, it is today a rich mix of many cultures and landscapes. The County is a blend of bustling cities, quaint villages and picturesque towns as well as open spaces and a network of beautiful parks. The County is also an intellectual capital, boasting a highly educated workforce, competitive colleges and universities, Fortune 500 companies, world changing non-profits, and cutting-edge research centers*

Pay: $71,800.00 - $89,305.00 per year

* Registered Dietitian (Required)

* Mount Vernon, NY (Required)

title: General Manager- Pest Control
description:
**We are growing rapidly here at EcoShield Pest Solutions and we are currently hiring a General Manager for our newest branch office.** 

**This is the perfect way to get in at the start of something great!**

**Location: Fairfield/Montclair area**

The Shield Co. Management / EcoShield Pest Solutions is one of the fastest-growing pest control companies in the country! Simply stated, we provide comprehensive solutions for pest-free living, but our purpose is to spread happiness. We accomplish that by delivering above-and-beyond experiences, not only to our customers but also to our employees, partners, and communities, who we consider family.

The General Manager is responsible for managing branch operations to safely achieve business goals, engage employees, satisfy customers, and maximize profitability.

If this sounds like you, We would love to hear from you.

Join the team and start spreading happiness by keeping bugs out of our customers’ beds, barbecues, bungalows, and businesses!

**Pay and Benefits**

The Company is proud to offer competitive pay, growth opportunities, full benefits, and monthly/quarterly/annual bonuses (in applicable positions)!

**For this role, we offer:**

* Competitive base salary ($95,000-$110,000, base DOE)
* Additional compensation opportunities- (Bonus and Incentive Pay)
* Paid time off
* Sick/Safe time - 1 hour per every 30 hours worked with a maximum of 80 hours annually
* Paid Vacation
* 10 company-paid holidays
* Benefits (employee as well as family)
* Medical
* Health Savings Account (HSA)
* Dental
* Vision
* Voluntary Life
* Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* 401(k), with a match of 100% of the first 3% of each employee’s contribution and 50% of the next 2%
* Employee Assistance Program
* Rally Health and Wellness Program
* Employee and Friends/Family Discounted Pest Control Services

**Job Description**

We understand that we cannot list every single task that you will do in this position, but below is an overview of our expectations:

* Oversee the daily operations and performance objectives of a branch
* Foster a high-performance culture and work environment, focusing on safety, inclusivity, and accountability
* Recruit, guide, train, and develop management and staff
* Train employees on safety and other company policies and procedures and maintain training records
* Monitor and ensure that licensing is appropriate and compliant with city and state requirements
* Ensure that the branch follows industry, safety, health, and business laws and regulations
* Uphold company standards of excellence and service, guaranteeing quality performance
* Assist with escalated customer issues and the management of incidents
* Achieve branch business goals, sales targets, revenue budgets, and KPIs
* Maximize company profits at assigned branch location

**Physical Demands and Working Conditions**  
The physical demands described here represent those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or listen. The employee frequently is required to walk. The employee is regularly required to stand; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, under or over objects
* The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds, and occasionally lift and/or move over 50 pounds
* Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions

* While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works in outside weather conditions and can be regularly exposed to extreme temperatures, including wet and/or humid conditions
* The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate

**Qualifications**

* 2+ years of management experience
* **Hold an active Driver's license with a clean driving record (must pass a motor vehicle record check and be 21 years of age to drive a Company vehicle and qualify for our vehicle insurance)**
* Have a commitment to safety in all job areas: driving, service, and training
* Committed to honest and exceptional customer service
* Willing to work Monday - Saturday and some holidays
* Earn and maintain the state-required training and licensingSpecific consideration will be given to candidates who meet the above qualifications and who:
* Have a Bachelor's degree in a related field
* Have pest control industry management experience
* Have state-required pest control operator licensing

The Shield Co. Management LLC/EcoShield Pest Solutions is an equal-opportunity employer

title: Temporary Fulfillment and Receiving Associate
description:
The Albert C. Wiltshire Employment Center recruits qualified candidates for positions within the Brooklyn Navy Yard, a 300-acre industrial park housing over 400+ businesses within the manufacturing, food, media, technology, and creative fields.

A Brooklyn Navy Yard-based clothing and accessories fashion design studio is currently seeking a **part-time temporary Fulfillment and Receiving Associate**.

**Job Summary**

We are looking for an enthusiastic and detail-oriented, part time temporary fulfillment and receiving associate for 10-20 hrs a week. Potential for additional hours in peak holiday times.

Options to work Mondays-Saturdays.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**

*Fulfillment*

* Pick and pack outgoing orders
* Utilize our shipping platform to fulfill orders
* Build shipping boxes
* Conduct rotating inventory checks on current products
* Check and document the work of others according to established guidelines
* Conduct quality control checks on outbound and inbound products
* Recognize and reconcile inventory discrepancies and report and communicate about it both internally and externally
* Prepare and track daily, weekly and monthly metrics as assigned
* Utilize technology platforms (including, but not limited to Loop, Gorgias, Google)
* Communicate with customers regarding issues related to fulfillment

*Receiving*

* Organize the product in the warehouse and maintain a clean and safe work environment
* Complete inventory counts and organizing inventory in incoming goods
* Maintain organized and accurate records
* Breaking down packaging materials and disposing of them afterwards
* Lifting and organizing boxes (occasionally up to ~100 lbs, anything over 50 lbs should be a team lift)
* Assist in the processing of bulk production shipment

*Returns*

* Manage and process returned inventory and restock once it is processed
* Collect packages from the central mail area
* Label and sort return packages upon their arrival
* Use our returns platform to confirm the content, check for damages and restock when applicable
* Process the returned goods, steaming, folding, repackaging, and placing back into inventory

**Skills include, but are not limited to:**

* 1-2 years of proven shipping and fulfillment experience
* Proficient with MS Office Suite, able to navigate Ship Station and other shipping web platforms
* Basic math skills and professional verbal/written communication skills
* Motivated, self-starter with excellent work ethic
* Must be highly efficient and detail oriented

**Benefits**

* PTO
* 50% Discount on all brand products during time of employment
* $300 in brand merchandise per quarter, during time of employment
* Experience in a growing e-commerce startup, growth opportunities
* Flexible schedule
* Mission driven company with goal to empower the LGBTQ+ community
* Growth opportunities within the company (marketing, customer service, operations, etc)

**Salary Band**

* $20-22/hr
